snippet.title: 10 DAYS: Anthony Scaramucci's wild ride in the Trump administration
snippet.content:
Only 10 days after he was hired as President Donald Trump's communications director, Anthony Scaramucci is unexpectedly .
Even though he was eventually let go at the urging of chief of staff John Kelly, the former communications director managed to cause quite a stir in his brief time at the White House - whether through against White House "leakers" or his with a company that has ties to the Chinese Communist Party.
Here is how "The Mooch" spent his short-lived but extremely colourful time as Trump's chief spokesperson.

In a Sunday CNN 'State of the Union' interview, Scaramucci that his new press secretary, Sarah Huckabee Sanders, should 'continue to use the hair and makeup person.' Even though he later justified his remark by using the hashtag #humour, his words caused one of the first major stirs in Scaramucci's brief time as communications director.
Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images Sarah Huckabee Sanders. On Monday, Sanders at Scaramucci's claims by saying 'he was able to go ahead and get his hair and makeup done.'
Anthony Scaramucci on CNN with Chris Cuomo making controversial claims 'They will all be fired by me,' Scaramucci told New Yorker reporter Ryan Lizza in that attacked numerous members of Trump's team on July 27. He went on to lash out against 'leakers' after Lizza had tweeted that Scaramucci had had dinner at the White House, which Scaramucci called a leak.
Scaramucci then said that former Chief of Staff Reince Priebus would be 'asked to resign very shortly.'
'I'm not Steve Bannon, I'm not trying to suck my own c--- ...,' Scaramucci went on to tell Lizza. 'I'm not trying to build my own brand off the f------ strength of the President.'
